result.execSummary:
The defendant David Edward Wiatrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Edward Wiatrowski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Edward Wiatrowski was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall pay restitution to Clerk of Courts with monthly payments. Bond from 21CF214 applied.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment. If not employed, seek work with at least three applications per week.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random urinalysis.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant shall report on or before 6 pm on 12/9/2022. 
Work release granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant David Edward Wiatrowski in court late.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for David Edward Wiatrowski.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to Count 1 with 3 years probation, counseling, random drug testing, 30 days jail, restitution $1000 by monthly payments as established by DOC, full time work or seek at 3 applications per week, costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Felony loss of rights explained. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 dismissed. State heard. Attorney Frank heard. Defendant agrees to pay $1000 in restitution for moped. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 3 years probation with $1000 restitution, counseling, random urinalysis, full time work or seek with three applications per week, costs, DNA, jail 26 days with work release (report by 6 pm on 12/9/22). Court reduces 30 days jail to 26 for time served in 21CF214. Credit if revoked, 4 days. Monthly payments to be made directly to Clerk of Courts.

Defendant David Edward Wiatrowski not in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for David Edward Wiatrowski.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin. Warrant authorized on State's motion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant David Edward Wiatrowski in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for David Edward Wiatrowski.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1 and State will move to dismiss Ct 2. State recommends 1 year probation with the following conditions: pay costs, 30 days jail, submit to random UAs, and to participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate. Court heard and sets a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant knowingly and freely waives his rights to a preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to go to SPD immediately after court. Court sets preliminary hearing.

Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David Edward Wiatrowski appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank appears by zoom. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Frank has not been appointed in this case. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests $500 cash bond. Attorney Frank heard and requests signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
